problem.markdown: A closed system exectutes two different processes between states 1 and 2. The first process, 1-A-2, is a quasi-static adiabatic process,and the work done during this process is 20 kJ. The second process,1-B-2 is a non-quasi-static adiabatic process. The work done in the second process (x)will equal 20 kJ. ( )will be greater than 20 kJ. ( )will be less than 20 kJ. ( )cannot be determined. [explanation] Since both 1-A-2 and 1-B-2 are adiabatic processes from the same initial state to the same final state, the work done will not depend on the path (First Law). [explanation]
problem.p: A closed system exectutes two different processes between states 1 and 2. The first process, 1-A-2, is a quasi-static adiabatic process,and the work done during this process is 20 kJ. The second process,1-B-2 is a non-quasi-static adiabatic process. The work done in the second process

div.p: Since both 1-A-2 and 1-B-2 are adiabatic processes from the same initial state to the same final state, the work done will not depend on the path (First Law).
